sections.title: A Note from Your Defiant Team

fields.message: We're here to help you find clarity and move forward confidently. This report summarizes what’s been found so far and what your next steps could look like.

sections.title: Your Diagnosis So Far

fields.diagnosis_summary: A small breast cancer was detected in your left breast during imaging. Your biopsy confirmed IDC, which is the most common type of breast cancer.

whatThisMeans.goodNews: This cancer was found early, and treatment outcomes are excellent.
whatThisMeans.newOptions: You’ll likely have several options for surgery and targeted therapies.
whatThisMeans.treatmentFocus: The focus is to remove the cancer and reduce recurrence risk.

sections.footer_note: We’ll confirm staging after imaging and surgical consultation.

sections.title: Your Next Steps
sections.description: We’ve outlined what to expect and where you are in your diagnostic journey.

items.name: Schedule MRI for surgical mapping
items.explanation: An MRI can confirm there are no other lesions.

items.name: Discuss surgery type with surgeon
items.explanation: You’ll review options for lumpectomy vs mastectomy.

sections.title: Treatment Planning (Preview)

fields.summary: Treatment will depend on final surgical findings and receptor testing. You’ll likely need a short course of radiation after surgery.
fields.disclaimer: This is an early planning overview and may change after surgery.

treatments.name: Lumpectomy
treatments.description: Removes the tumor and surrounding tissue while conserving the breast.

side_effects.description: Changes in breast shape or sensitivity

treatments.name: Adjuvant Radiation Therapy
treatments.description: Targets any remaining cancer cells after surgery.

clinical_trials.name: TailorX Extended Outcomes Study
clinical_trials.description: Examines outcomes for women with early-stage HR+ breast cancer.

sections.disclaimer_footer: This section is informational only and not a treatment recommendation.

sections.title: Questions to Ask at Your Next Visit
sections.description: Bring these to your next consultation so you feel confident about your care plan.

questions.text: Can you explain what stage I means in my situation?

definition_terms.definition: An early-stage breast cancer that is small and has not spread.

questions.text: Are any additional tests or scans needed before surgery?
Will I need radiation after surgery?
What are the pros and cons of lumpectomy vs mastectomy?

sections.footer_note: Tip: bring a friend or record the visit (with your doctor’s consent).
